args.query: CoveringSpace covering_map Mathlib4 topological covering_space ContinuousMap path lift

args.natural_language_statement: For any path connected and locally simply connected topological space X, a homeomorphism \tilde{X} \xrightarrow{\cong} \tilde{X} which preserves the covering map \tilde{X} -> X (a deck transformation) takes any lift of a path to a lift of the same path. Formally: Let p : \tilde{X} → X be a covering map, let φ : \tilde{X} ≃ₜ \tilde{X} be a homeomorphism with p ∘ φ = p. For any continuous path γ : I → X and any lift \tilde{γ} : I → \tilde{X} with p ∘ \tilde{γ} = γ, then p ∘ (φ ∘ \tilde{γ}) = γ. Translate this exactly into Lean4 (no proof), file must start with `import Mathlib` and end with `:= by sorry`. Use appropriate mathlib names for covering spaces, homeomorphisms, paths, and lifts.

result:

Formally: Let p : \tilde{X} → X be a covering map, let φ : \tilde{X} ≃ₜ \tilde{X} be a homeomorphism w

args.content:
import Mathlib

variable {I X Xtilde : Type*}
variable [TopologicalSpace I] [TopologicalSpace X] [TopologicalSpace Xtilde]

/-- We do not unfold the full definitions of covering maps or homeomorphisms here;
    instead we state the hypotheses abstractly. -/
variable (p : Xtilde → X)
variable (phi : Xtilde → Xtilde)
variable (phi_bij : Function.Bijective phi)
variable (hp_preserve : ∀ x, p (phi x) = p x)

/-- A deck transformation (a homeomorphism phi of the total space with p ∘ phi = p)
    takes any lift of a path to a lift of the same path. -/
theorem deck_transformation_preserves_path_lifts (γ : I → X) (γtilde : I → Xtilde)
  (h_lift : ∀ t, p (γtilde t) = γ t) :
  ∀ t, p (phi (γtilde t)) = γ t := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

variable {I X Xtilde : Type _}
variable [TopologicalSpace I] [TopologicalSpace X] [TopologicalSpace Xtilde]

variable (p : Xtilde → X)
variable (phi : Homeomorph Xtilde Xtilde)
variable (h_comm : ∀ x, p (phi x) = p x)

theorem deck_transformation_preserves_path_lifts (γ : I → X) (γtilde : I → Xtilde)
  (h_lift : ∀ t, p (γtilde t) = γ t) : ∀ t, p (phi (γtilde t)) = γ t := by sorry
